tutorial.label: What's New in 3.3
tutorial.description:
This panel describes some of the new features and behavior changes included in this update.

To open this panel again later, select Help > What's New in Android Studio from the main menu.

stepElement.section: A visual editor for the XML resource that the new Navigation Architecture Component uses to handle navigation actions at runtime. Learn more

Click File > Project Structure to use the improved Project Structure dialog, which now allows you to better manage build variants and their properties; visualize the dependency graph of each module; verify that dependencies are up-to-date; and more. Learn more

For projects that configure multiple build variants, you can now optimize project syncs to run only on the build variant you currently have selected.

If the IDE doesn't prompt you to enable this optimization, enable it manually by navigating to Settings/Preferences > Experimental > Gradle and checking the box next to Only resolve selected variants. Learn more

If you've already opted into sharing usage statistics to help improve Android Studio, you'll see these two new icons in the status bar at the bottom of the IDE window:

Simply click the icon that best represents your current experience with the IDE. When you do so, the IDE sends usage statistics that allows the Android Studio team to better understand your sentiment. Learn more
